materials.raw_text: Co: 11 g, Er: 2 g, Fe: 7 g, Y: 4 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Obtain from a chemical supplier or metal alloy provider. Er: Available at specialty rare earth material suppliers. Fe: Obtain from a local hardware store or metal supply. Y: Source from a chemical supply company focusing on rare earth elements.
steps: Co: Obtain from a chemical supplier or metal alloy provider. Er: Available at specialty rare earth material suppliers. Fe: Obtain from a local hardware store or metal supply. Y: Source from a chemical supply company focusing on rare earth elements.

1. Weigh out 11 g of cobalt (Co), 2 g of erbium (Er), 7 g of iron (Fe), and 4 g of yttrium (Y) using a calibrated scale. 2. Place the measured powders into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform consistency is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 11 g of cobalt (Co), 2 g of erbium (Er), 7 g of iron (Fe), and 4 g of yttrium (Y) using a calibrated scale. 2. Place the measured powders into a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until a uniform consistency is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ball mill and mill for 2 hours to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate sintering.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a high-temperature furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the mixed powder in a ceramic crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the furnace and maintain the temperature for 4 hours to facilitate sintering.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. This process should take approximately 6-8 hours to avoid thermal shock to the material.

steps: 1. Remove the cooled crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solid sample from the crucible. 3. Use a grinding tool to smooth any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to the surface to enhance durability and prevent oxidation. 5. Allow the coating to cure as per manufacturer's instructions before final use.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the cooled crucible from the furnace. 2. Carefully extract the solid sample from the crucible. 3. Use a grinding tool to smooth any rough edges and achieve the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 4. Optionally, apply a protective coating to the surface to enhance durability and prevent oxidation. 5. Allow the coating to cure as per manufacturer's instructions before final use.
